borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed development, by reason of its scale, siting and design would compromise the quality of the semi-detached property sitting within its own plot and seperated from neighbouring properties. By infilling the gaps surounding the dwellinghouse, it would generate harm upon the character of its plot and typology as a semi-detached bungalow. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy D4 and D8 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policy&nbsp; BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);&nbsp;</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);&nbsp;</p><p>- Policies SP2, SP4, DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020</p>

<p>The scale, siting and design of the proposed development would result in increased overshadowing into the rear gardens of the properties to the north of the site on Melbourne Gardens, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);<br></p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</p><p>- Policy DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020).</p>
description: Construction of a single storey side extension with pitched roof.
